CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 16, 1954, pg. 16, reads: "'Aida' Makes Curtain - 'Aida,' presented by the National Negro Opera Foundation, Inc., and its Pittsburgh Opera Guild, at Syria Mosque Saturday night overcame difficulties and answered critics of the effort by giving a commendable performance. It was a tribute to Mme. Mary Dawson, founder and organizer of the NNOF, and her associates... court attendants, seated, left to right, Ezra Murphy, Ellen Favor, Walter Burt Jackson and Martine Dalton, standing, left to right, Barbara Taylor, Rita Maria Carrington, Mary E. Jackson and Piccola Burton."
TitMainTitle: Cast members of National Negro Opera Company production of "Aida" from left: Ezra Murphy, Ellen Favor, Walter Burt Jackson and Martine Dalton; standing: Barbara Taylor, Rita Maria Carrington, Mary E. Jackson and Piccola Burton, in Syria Mosque
